Header: At least 26 dead after fishing boat capsizes off Honduran coast
Content: At least 26 people died after a lobster-fishing boat capsized off the Atlantic coast of Honduras during poor weather conditions in one of the countryâ€™s worst-ever accidents at sea. Forty-seven people were rescued after the accident near Puerto Lempira, said Jose Domingo Meza. Boats regularly gather off the Honduran coast for lobster-fishing. Another fishing boat capsized earlier in the day in the same region because of the poor weather, but all 49 people onboard were rescued. Honduras lobster exports generated $46 million in 2018 and were sent mostly to the United States.
